hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Recovery Momentum After Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a market stress event (liquidity crash), the first 3-day period where BTC's 5-day average volume increases by >15% while funding rates remain negative (<-0.005%) predicts a 7-day BTC price rally of >8% with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Negative funding during volume recovery suggests short covering potential while new buyers enter. October's liquidity crash created structural oversold conditions; early volume recovery signals institutional re-entry before retail FOMO.
entry_conditions: BTC 5-day rolling average volume increases >15% from previous 5-day period
BTC perpetual funding rate remains negative (<-0.005%) for 3 consecutive days
Market regime transitions from STRESS to NEUTRAL
BTC price above 200-day MA (confirmation of structural support)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7 days after entry OR +8% price appreciation, whichever comes first
exit_conditions.time_exit: If no +8% move within 10 trading days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >40% of such signals fail to produce >5% returns within 10 days OR if negative funding persists beyond 7 days without price appreciation.
